intro: Buchnera euphrasioides, commonly known as the yellow toadflax, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow or orange tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. It has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its stems are erect and somewhat woody at the base. Buchnera euphrasioides is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
